docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)--The National Academy of Sciences has concluded that saccharin "must be viewed as a potential cause of cancer in humans," not only because it is a weak cancer-causing agent itself but also because it may promote the cancer-causing activity of other substances.

headline.main: Saccharin Is Potential Carcinogen In Humans, Science Academy Says; 'Low-Potency' Carcinogen

docs.abstract: Natl Acad of Sciences rept says saccharin is potential carcinogen in humans; Donald Kennedy lauds rept but Calorie Control Council opposes it (M)
